isis.stitle: TSI 91-08-03 - Installation Guidelines For High Output Radio Transmitters

subjectgroup.subject: Installation Guidelines For High Output Radio Transmitters

geninfo.para: International vehicles are using more and more electronic devices such as electronic engines, instrument clusters, entertainment radios, intermittent wiper switches, hydromax monitor modules, antilock brakes and soon electronic transmissions. The following guidelines should be followed to reduce the possibility of radio frequency interference (RFI) affecting these components.

item.para: Transmitters of this type usually have a control module mounted on the dashboard with the power unit mounted elsewhere. The power unit should be mounted on the back wall or floor of the cab. Any excess cable between the control module and the power unit should be secured at the power unit. Keep cable from the control module to the power unit away from vehicle harnesses.

The positive and negative supply cables to the power unit should exit through the rear floor of the cab and connect directly to the batteries (or as close as possible). Use suitable circuit protection for the positive cable (fuse or circuit breaker). Route cables along and close to the crossmember and frame rails. Power cables should be twisted together if possible.

Antennas should be roof mounted for best performance. Antenna leads should enter from the rear of the cab. It is especially important that the antenna leads be protected from possible damage and that they have good end connections to avoid "leakage" of RFI.
The SWR (standing wave ratio) of the antenna should be measured to be sure it is in the range of 1.0 to 1.5. SWR's above 1.5 may indicate an installation problem.

Good grounds between the cab, frame, engine and hood (if metal) are essential. Add suitable flat braided ground strap between these components when needed. The ends of the ground straps should be secured to clean bare metal and then coated with Grafo grease (part number 472141C1).
Professional installation of these types of radios is recommended.
